definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

sentences.english: That swindle soured a great many potential investors.
sentences.chinese: 那種行騙行爲令許多想去投資的人慾往而止。

sentences.english: At the time, the real attorney was living in Russia.
sentences.chinese: 在裏德爾行騙期間，那位律師正居住在俄羅斯。

sentences.english: It is she that gives them the site for wangling.
sentences.chinese: 是她爲他們提供了行騙的場地。

sentences.english: It says, there is a man going around pretending he's from the electricity board.
sentences.chinese: 上面說，有個人假裝他是電力局的到處行騙。

sentences.english: China is on almost every dimension cheating.
Eg:He often hustles on the streets to pay for drugs.
sentences.chinese: 爲弄到錢買毒品，他常在街上行騙。

sentences.english: I have every confidence in my scrounging abilities.
sentences.chinese: 我對自己的行騙技巧充滿自信。

sentences.english: That's the con man's scheme - to sound like he knows a lot and you don't.
sentences.chinese: 這名男子的行騙的計劃聽起來就像他知道很多，你不。
在任何情況下都不要行騙。

sentences.english: Bob makes his living as a con artist.
sentences.chinese: 鮑勃是位行騙高手，並以行騙爲生。

sentences.english: Bob makes his living as a con artist.
sentences.chinese: 鮑勃是位行騙高手，並以行騙爲生。

sentences.english: Her eyes blazed when she saw him cheating.
sentences.chinese: 當她看見他行騙時，她雙眼直冒火。

sentences.english: For years he then worked the con in Las Vegas before fleeing to England in the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 他在拉斯維加斯行騙多年，之後在70年代移師英國。

sentences.english: He often hustles on the streets to pay for drugs。
sentences.chinese: 爲弄到錢買毒品，他常在街上行騙。

sentences.english: Jinlong discovers Zhu Guanzhong is heavily in debt and intends to use the Xintiandi project to swindle money.
sentences.chinese: 金龍發現朱冠中欠債累累並意圖利用新天地計劃行騙。

sentences.english: A clever look at con artists and their games of deception.
sentences.chinese: 這是對行騙者和他們的詭計的一次有趣描寫。

definition: to steal (including identity theft, credit card fraud or theft of computer account)/to misappropriate
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
